_header: Under your hood is but one countenance
Note: The same refrain also serves for 5410.
_description: John Lydgate, ‘Ballade per antiphrasim’ — four 8-line stanzas

BodRawC48.First Lines:
VNdir your hood is but oo contenaunceExcludid is from you al
                    doubilnesse…
BodRawC48.Last Lines:
…Thes be as sothe of you where that ye beAs I goo loos and
                    teied a withe a Lyne
BodRawC48.Note:
Two last stanzas are fragmentary because the corner of the folio is torn
                    off.
BodRawC48.Editions:
MacCracken,  Henry Noble,
                        ed.  
             John Lydgate: The Minor Poems, Vol. II: Secular Poems.
EETS
         o.s. 192 (1934); repr. 1961: 432-3.
